name: Kepler-239
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-239 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-239 is a star with 0.655 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.76 times its radius. It is located 2152.86 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-239 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-239 b

Kepler-239 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.76 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-239.

The mass of Kepler-239 b is 7.34 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-239 b is 2.33 that of Earth. At 7.34 Earth masses, Kepler-239 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-239 c

Kepler-239 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.27 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 56.23 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-239.

The mass of Kepler-239 c is 8.77 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-239 c is 2.51 that of Earth. At 8.77 Earth masses, Kepler-239 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-239, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
